item.title: Report E-2025020324
item.description:
Report E-2025020324

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-20
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0947 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XML. It was reported that approximately 1 quart of UN1866 released from 1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer # 3178627. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal does not currently have any drums onsite. Terminal will update waste container once drum received. The impacted drum is not impeding dock operations. XPO advised an overpack will be ordered and utilized once received. The current damaged drum is not actively leaking.

item.title: Report E-2025020251
item.description:
Report E-2025020251

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-20
  • City: HUDSON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6540
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was attempting to drain the residual diesel fuel from the delivery hose after completing his delivery. Approximately 10 gallons of diesel fuel was released. Enivroserve responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
